title: CourseHub
description: CourseHub is a large-scale, open-source adaptive learning platform designed specifically for Ethiopian universities. It centralizes curriculum-aligned academic resources, supports community-driven moderation, and introduces optional AI-powered study aids through the Google Gemini API. The system is architected with strict data isolation, role-based access control, and optimized row-level security policies. Built with Next.js, Supabase, PostgreSQL, and MongoDB, CourseHub emphasizes scalability, performance, and real-world academic workflows, making it suitable for institutional adoption.

title: RAG Chatbot
description: A production-ready Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) chatbot featuring dual parallel implementations in Python and JavaScript. The project enables direct performance comparison between a Haystack-based Python pipeline and a Node.js-native RAG system using client-side embeddings. It includes automatic failover, benchmarking utilities, real-time chat via WebSockets, and multi-LLM support. Designed with reliability and performance in mind, the JavaScript implementation demonstrated over 50% faster response times in benchmark testing.

title: Project Addis
description: A full-stack song management system developed as an internship test project for Addis Software PLC. The application supports complete CRUD operations, pagination, search with debouncing, and modern UI patterns. Built using a manually configured Webpack setup and Redux Toolkit with Redux-Saga, this project reflects rapid learning, practical problem-solving, and real-world engineering trade-offs under time constraints.

title: Project Crypto
description: A CoinGecko-inspired cryptocurrency tracking dashboard that provides real-time market data, interactive charts, and educational content. The system uses a secure Express.js backend as an API proxy with caching, rate limiting, and validation to ensure performance and reliability. The frontend is built with modern React and TypeScript, focusing on responsive design, data visualization, and clean UI architecture.

title: Personal Expense Tracker
description: A feature-rich personal finance application that enables users to track expenses, manage budgets, and analyze spending patterns. The system integrates Google Gemini AI to parse natural language expense inputs, supports recurring transactions, and provides detailed visual analytics. Built with a secure authentication flow and scalable backend architecture, the project demonstrates applied AI usage in a practical, user-focused domain.

title: letsBuild
description: letsBuild is a community-driven idea sharing platform where users can publish, vote on, and discuss ideas written in Markdown. Ideas are ranked based on engagement metrics such as votes, views, and comments. The platform emphasizes clean design, smooth animations, and scalable state management patterns, making it suitable for collaborative creativity and knowledge sharing.

title: Project Issues
description: A modern issue tracking and project management tool inspired by Linear.app. Built for speed and clarity, it features workspace-based collaboration, real-time updates, keyboard-driven workflows, and a clean Kanban interface. The system is architected with Supabase for realtime data, authentication, and storage, and is designed to evolve toward AI-assisted planning and semantic search.

title: GymBro
description: A personal workout tracking application built to log exercises, sets, reps, and weights while providing long-term progress insights. Designed primarily for private use, uses MongoDB as its primary database. The project focuses on data modeling, performance tracking, and clean UI for daily personal use.

title: You and Your Home
description: A comprehensive e-commerce web application developed as a university project, featuring product listings, category browsing, shopping cart functionality, and basic user flows. The project emphasizes full CRUD operations, responsive UI design, and integration between a modern React frontend and a PHP/MySQL backend. It was designed to simulate a real-world online marketplace with attention to usability and data handling.

title: Dictionary
description: A lightweight dictionary web application that integrates with the Free Dictionary API to fetch word definitions, phonetics, synonyms, and related terms. Built with vanilla JavaScript, the project focuses on API consumption, asynchronous data handling, and clean UI rendering without the use of modern frameworks.

title: Manage School v2
description: A desktop-based Student Management System designed to manage students, courses, and academic records. The application uses JavaFX for the user interface and MySQL for persistent storage. It demonstrates object-oriented design, relational data modeling, and basic CRUD workflows within a desktop application context.

title: Password Generator
description: A secure password generation tool available as a web application and Chrome extension. It allows users to generate strong passwords with configurable length and character rules. The project focuses on client-side logic, randomness, and usability while reinforcing security-conscious development practices.

title: Other Me
description: A GitHub profile explorer that consumes the GitHub Users API to display public profile data, repositories, and statistics. This project focuses on external API integration, asynchronous requests, and dynamic UI updates using vanilla web technologies.
